content: Soundarajan, Neelam | Computer Science and Engineering Skip to main content Neelam Soundarajan Associate Professor, Computer Science and Engineering Dreese Laboratories2015 Neil Ave Columbus, OH 43210-1210 (614) 292-1444 soundarajan.1@osu.edu Download CV General site STEM Games Biography My primary areas of interest are Software Engineering and Programming Languages with a focus on formal reasoning about the correctness of programs. A second area of interest is Computer Science education and, more broadly, STEM education including at the high-school level. Recently, I have become interested in the potential of video games to dramatically improve the quality of STEM education. I am also interested in approaches to assessment and program improvement of Computer Science programs. Over the last several years, I have served as a program evaluator (PEV) as well as a Team Chair (TC) for the ABET/CAC evaluation of a number of Computer Science programs. As the past chair of the CSE Department's Undergraduate Studies Committee, I was primarily responsible for overseeing the successful accreditation evaluation of the BS-CSE program over several cycles. Expertise Software engineering and programming languages Innovative approaches to STEM education Accreditation and assessment of Computer Science programs
